originalText.text:
Never take Amtrak. Just don‚Äôt.
The delays from freight priority and broken down engine cars are nothing compared to the awful customer service and terrible quality of travel - trains arrive 3 hours late and then spend another 4 hours on a track, and had to deal with rainwater coming in the roof and onto my head. Nothing changes because they‚Äôre owned by the government and can keep using our tax dollars to line their pockets while providing late, unsafe, and subpar service. Fly or take a bus, never trust these clowns.

originalText.text: I had a reserved ticket for coach class on a specific date, with no specific seat number assigned, and no further instructions clarified in my ticket or anywhere on the Amtrak website that I could find. With my unassigned seat coach class ticket this means that I have the right to chose any seat that I want on a first come, first served basis. Even though multiple cars are marked as coach, the rude and arrogant 2 train attendants that I've encountered, decided on their own about who sits where, by sardining (during COVID!) "short" distance passengers together into one packed car. Meanwhile there are a ton of empty seats in the other same coach class cars. And there still were a ton of seats even after I departed! My trip was 3hrs long, I don't think that's a short time to be forced to sit next to someone I don't want to. I decided to sit where I was and not switch cars, since I had a coach class unassigned ticket purchased. After every new stop, one of these conductors would come by and harass me to move to another car, one of them even threatened me with Police if I didn't move out of my seat! Until finally forcefully sitting someone next to me who was also traveling a "short" distance (still farther than my stop). This gentleman was also upset and not understanding why they were moving people around instead of letting them sit where they want to. Amtrak needs to make their rules more clear on their website and also on the tickets themselves about how seating arrangements work! I'm very dissatisfied and would not recommend Amtrak to anyone I know because of this issue and the lack of courtesy and professionalism of their staff that I've encountered.

originalText.text:
Amtrak is heaping pile of Garbagio! I had a ticket in cart for a certain price, went to check out in 2 seconds and they switched the price, by double.
I'm sure I'm not the only one is happened to. Sent complaint to their customer service and not even a peep after multiple tries. Garbagio!

originalText.text: I've been taking amtrak for years now going up and down from the city for work and this past weekend I was completely deceive by them. I was going to book the more expensive train that left earlier howvere the 1pm train was the minimum of 45$. The train ended up being 35 minutes late and the lady on the PA system had the nerve to tell us all she would charge over 220$ if we didn't make sure out bags and personal belongings were clear from the other seat. They then proceeded to stop in the middle of nowhere for 45 mins "we are waiting only a few minutes for the train to leave the station infront of us" is what she said. Then we sped down the tracks at an abnormal rate of speed with the train wobbly and shaking all over ... only to slow down again ad wait another 15 . Minutes at a snails üêå  pace. All in all we are going to be over and hours and 45 minutes late. It was said to hear people canceling there doctors appointments and dinner reservations as I had to also. I was extremely disappointed in Amtrak for even having this train on the track it should have been canceled and I will be taking greyhound from now on.

originalText.text:
Message for the most senior management only.  STEP UP YOUR GAME and  customer service!  Stop making excuses and saying sorry - fix the problems or  let someone'll try.

We upgraded for business seats, fine - and paid a upgrade fee, not the issue. I wasn't allowed to choose. We were assigned aisle seats NOT together. I did NOT want, nor request the bid system either and couldn't reverse it.

Tried to cancel and no go, app didn't work, phone support was ineffective and frustrating. They too are simply attempting to earn a living.

Credit card was charged for both legs yet no seats assigned for the overbooked return trip.

It's always been like this? NO, NO it has not!  Stop making excuses and START providing  customers AND employees the service they deserve!

The only and I must reiterate only thing amtrak has in its favor is once again, you don't have to drive. That's IT. It is NOT quicker, nor cheaper.

Frankly, I will drive next time to NYC, vs the bs with the train. That IS sad.

While I dislike negative reviews, when companies go this far out of their way this often with 0.0 accountability - it MUST be shared.

I don't have time to make this up, nor would I waste the readers time. This is not the first, nor an isolated nor an unusual experience with amtrak, yet it's the one that prompted this review.

It's difficult to support funding poor customer service, overbooking, no ability to select seats, truly deceptive change policies and consistently delayed to hit highlights.

I sincerely wish one lane each direction of every interstate to be replaced with rail. Too bad there is not a passenger rail service that could handle that ü§î.

PS - Hmmm, what would be so bad in actually making the train enjoyable by having all seats/cars be the business class type and allow people to actually pick seats and enjoy the trip?  Provide "local tickets" on "local cars" if folks are going one or two stops.  WOW!  ;-)   I just increased your customer satisfaction, AND increased ridership by at least 30% guaranteed!

Please have my consulting fee sent to address on file.

Vb
-dave
